image.altText: Blonde woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Police have arrested the husband of Frances Crawford, who died in a ride-on lawnmower incident in July, over her alleged murder.

title.children: Husband arrested over alleged murder of Queensland psychologist who died in ride-on lawnmower incident

image.altText: Man in scenic shot.

props.synopsis: Blake Wilson was killed when a helicopter he was flying crashed into the roof of the hotel on the Cairns Esplanade in August.

title.children: Pilot who crashed helicopter into roof of Cairns hotel was affected by alcohol, investigation finds

image.altText: man smiles at camera standing in front of large truck

props.synopsis: The Toowoomba Bypass promised to fix the town's commute issues. But five years later, it remains only partially open, and prone to "close calls" for truck drivers.

title.children: Graeme's trucks travel on the Toowoomba Bypass up to 50 times each day, and every trip is a headache

image.altText: A dark-haired woman stands in a unit near a window that overlooks a road.

props.synopsis: A man broke into this woman's home and raped her after she returned from a jog. She's challenging courts and prisons to do justice differently in the hope of curbing re-offending and putting survivors at the centre of the story.

title.children: Woman raped by a stranger in her own home finds justice meeting attacker in prison

image.altText: A selfie of a man

props.synopsis: Police say they have increased concerns for a man who disappeared in Queensland's South Burnett region after shoes were discovered as part of widespread search efforts.Â

title.children: Police say disappearance of man is 'increasingly concerning' after shoes discovered

image.altText: New laws for criminal bikie gangs

props.synopsis: Detectives say outlaw motorcycle gangs are "not welcome" on the Sunshine Coast, and have vowed to not let them gain a foothold.

title.children: Police arrest three suspected outlaw motorcycle gang members after car rammed, driver assaulted

image.altText: An aerial photo of kingfisher bay resort with the beach and barge

props.synopsis: A noxious pest from Africa has found its way onto the world's largest sand island, Kâgari. Experts are calling for the invasive fish to be eradicated to stop it from threatening native species.

title.children: Aggressive fish invading waterways on popular Queensland tourist island

image.altText: An aerial shot of people standing on a roof, surrounded by floodwaters.

props.synopsis: The tiny town of Grantham in the Lockyer Valley was hit twice by devastating floods. Here's why it's still going strong.

title.children: We have to move the town: A mayor's bold plan to save his devastated community

image.altText: robbie katter frowning

props.synopsis: Less than a decade after abortion was decriminalised, the debate this time would be about whether to reinstate it as a criminal offence, writes Matt Eaton.

title.children: Did a minor Queensland party just make abortion an election issue?

image.altText: A woman holds her young daughter in a daycare playground

props.synopsis: After nearly 10 months and $180,000 in community-funded upgrades parents are rejoicing following the reopening of a childcare centre in a town where waitlists can stretch more than three years.

title.children: Outback community rallies to reopen run-down childcare centre amid three-year waitlists for parents

image.altText: Voters must now number every square on the ballot paper.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, Queensland Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: Queensland Votes 2024 â stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: Jandowae crop damage

props.synopsis: The SES has received 90 calls for help over the past 24 hours, predominantly from residents in the Moreton Bay area, north of Brisbane.

title.children: Severe thunderstorms lash south-east Queensland, bringing heavy rain, flash flooding and hail

image.altText: Yung Filly smiling on stage holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: British YouTube personality and rapper Yung Filly is accused of sexually assaulting a woman in his hotel room following a show at a Perth nightclub.

title.children: British rapper Yung Filly charged with sexually assaulting woman in Perth hotel room

image.altText: A wide show of a beach overlooking a tropical bay

props.synopsis: Labor and LNP candidates in one of Queensland's most marginal state seats had dangled promises to purchase and conserve the coastal headland Taylor Point, but a private buyer has swooped in.

title.children: Mystery buyer reveals plans for multi-million-dollar tropical Cairns headland

image.altText: Sheila Raymond and family members

props.synopsis: Sheila Thurlow's family is calling for an inquest into her death at a Brisbane hospital after she was injected with 1,000 times the intended dose of morphine.

title.children: Nurse 'Googled' hospital procedure night before woman was given 1,000 times the intended level of morphine

image.altText: Young adult woman in black blazer stands in front of garden bed with neutral expression

props.synopsis: Federation University is set to cop the biggest reduction Australia-wide under a proposed cap on international student numbers, with a 52 per cent reduction in new overseas enrolments compared to its 2023 intake.

title.children: Senate backs bill which would halve international student population at Federation University

image.altText: crisafulli and gerber listening to a constituent's question

props.synopsis: David Crisafulli has once again sidestepped questions about whether he would allow a conscience vote on a future KAP bill to repeal abortion laws â and why he voted against Labor's decriminalisation bill in 2018.

title.children: LNP leader refuses to say if his MPs will get conscience vote on abortion

image.altText: A family of four embrace in outback Australia

props.synopsis: Outback tourism operators are feeling the squeeze as soaring costs and increasing global competition cut into visitor numbers.

title.children: This Queensland family sold their home to experience outback Australia

image.altText: A graphic shows a ballot box with Olympics 2032 written on it.

props.synopsis: There's a predictable pattern an Olympics host city goes through in the lead-up to holding the biggest sporting event on earth. First there's excitement, then there's disillusionment â that's arguably where Brisbane is now.

title.children: 'Let's dump the Olympics': Games host cities follow a predictable pattern, starting with excitement. Brisbane is at 'disillusionment'

image.altText: Man in blue shirt smiling at a shorter woman in a pink shirt.

props.synopsis: There was never any question Michael Pitt was going to work on the land. But a mustering accident triggered a long-held desire to become a doctor, and now he and his nurse wife Katie use their agricultural backgrounds to connect with rural patients.

title.children: After a bull charged at him, this grazier retrained to become a doctor

image.altText: A man and a woman hugging at Brisbane Airport.

props.synopsis: There were emotional scenes at Brisbane Airport this morning as another repatriation flight from Lebanon touched down amid the conflict in the Middle East.

title.children: Emotional scenes as repatriation flight from Lebanon arrives in Brisbane

image.altText: Adam John Charles Evans

props.synopsis: The court heard Adam John Charles Evans and another man dumped the victim's mobility scooter in the Brisbane River after stuffing his body in a wheelie bin.Â

title.children: Brisbane man who bashed Kym Mitchell to death and put his body in a wheelie bin jailed for 18 years

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a dark suit, smiles, and shakes hands with Li Qiang who is in a black suit

props.synopsis: It will be his fifth meeting with Li Qiang, and his second in only a few months.

title.children: Anthony Albanese will meet Chinese Premier Li Qiang on the sidelines of ASEAN summit

image.altText: lobster 3

props.synopsis: China announces it will lift its import ban on Australian rock lobster, one of the last bans in place after Australia was put in the diplomatic deep freeze. Follow live.

title.children: China lifts rock lobster ban as PM meets with Chinese premier in Laos

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Indigenous minister "surprised" about Payman's "voice" party name

image.altText: A torn American flag weaves in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene and before the arrival of Hurricane Milton, St. Pete BeachFlorida

props.synopsis: Incredible pictures of the devastation of Hurricane Milton in the US are already being shared online. But amongst the real footage is a flood of fakes. Here's how to spot them.

title.children: Before you believe that hurricane video you just saw, ask yourself these four questions

image.altText: A man recording on a go pro in windy wet weather.

props.synopsis: Hurricane Milton is downgraded shortly after making landfall but is still dangerous, with a rare flash flood emergency statement issued for the Tampa Bay area and a stadium roof torn off. Follow live.

title.children: Hurricane Milton downgraded to category two over Florida as stadium roof destroyed

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks downwards.

props.synopsis: A senior staffer to Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles has alleged she was forced out of her job after raising an internal bullying complaint.Â

title.children: Deputy PM's top staffer says she was forced out of her job after raising a bullying complaint

image.altText: A sign reads 'BEAUMARIS PRIMARY SCHOOL' behind gum leaves.

props.synopsis: A survivor of "shocking" sexual abuse at a Melbourne primary school has received what his lawyer has called "the biggest publicly-known payment to an abuse survivor in Australia" in an extraordinary $8 million settlement with the Victorian Education Department.

title.children: Sexual abuse survivor to receive $8 million in record-breaking settlement

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark green hijab and blazer stands in a grass field, serious expression on her face

props.synopsis: Fatima Payman's new political party may not be troubling Labor, but it still has plenty of other headaches to worry about.

title.children: Fatima Payman's big reveal of her new political party has done little to trouble Labor

image.altText: Aran Sherani, wearing a grey tracksuit, arrives at the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A man found guilty of terrorism-related offences after he lit bushfires and pledged his allegiance to Islamic State will spend at least six years behind bars.

title.children: Man found guilty of terrorism-related offences sentenced to at least six years behind bars

image.altText: A man with a beard stands in the house of representatives.

props.synopsis: The government has surprised the Coalition by announcing an inquiry into the deployment of nuclear power, including small modular reactors, to report back by April 30.

title.children: Labor MP hopes nuclear power inquiry will help answer voters' 'many questions'

image.altText: A dark-haired woman wearing a black jacket staring directly at the camera

props.synopsis: The ACT Greens defend their vetting process after admitting to knowing about a candidate's blog post comparing September 11 mastermind Osama bin Laden to Jesus Christ.

title.children: ACT Greens vetting process in question after candidate's blog post about terrorist leader Bin Laden surfaced

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding a phone. It is superimposed on a drawing of Australia and surrounded by social media apps

props.synopsis: As a social media summit this week discusses the merits of Australia's proposed world-leading ban for teenagers, Ange Lavoipierre asks: why have so few others made it down this path?

title.children: No other government has enforced a total ban for teenagers on social media â so why does Australia think it can?
